meta_description: Keeler Tavern Museum in Ridgefield, CT provides educational and cultural programs on colonial life, exhibitions and public events in our carriage house, and a garden for hosting special events.
hours_text:
## Plan Your Visit

##### **“All museums should be like the Keeler! . . . Thought-provoking and made me curious, which is what one hopes for in a museum.”**

Welcome to Keeler Tavern Museum & History Center! Whether you have one hour or one day, we invite you to explore all our site has to offer: from engaging tours to interactive exhibits, gorgeous gardens to an ongoing slate of fascinating programs.

NOTE: The Museum is closed for public tours in January and February. We reopen on March 1, 2026. Our Business Office continues regular hours during this time, and the grounds and garden are open for self-guided experiences from dawn to dusk.

[Buy Tickets](https://keelertavernmuseum.org/visit/hours-admission/)

accessibility_text:
## Directions, Parking, and Accessibility

**Keeler Tavern Museum & History Center**  
152 Main Street  
Ridgefield, Connecticut 06877

### Directions

The Museum is conveniently located on over four beautiful acres at 152 Main Street (Route 35), the southern anchor of the Cultural District in historic Ridgefield, Connecticut. It is easy to reach from major highways throughout the tri-state region.

### Parking: Museum

Follow the signs for the Main Entrance at 152 Main Street. Our driveway is the one closest to the Main Entrance sign. Park in the lot behind the brick Visitor Center at 152 Main Street and enter the Visitor Center through the back entrance, which abuts the parking lot and is denoted by a tented entryway. Bus parking is available on premises; please contact the [Museum office](/about/contact-us?1mailto_id=4) for details.

### Parking: Private Events

Visitors attending a private event at KTM&HC should enter the parking lot at 152 Main Street, using the driveway closest to the Main Entrance sign. Private event guests will be greeted by a parking attendant, who will provide further instructions for parking.

### Accessibility

KTM&HC’s Visitor Center (which includes restrooms/changing tables, Front Desk, snacks and drinks for purchase, and small exhibits), Carriage Barn, Garden House, Walled Garden, and most of the grounds are wheelchair accessible. Welcome! Keeler Tavern Museum & History Center is a beautiful, four-acre site in the heart of Ridgefield, CT that preserves and interprets hundreds of years of local and national history. We provide educational and cultural programs that connect past and present, with a focus on our former residents' experiences in the colonial era through the early 20th century.
